h2. Dependencies

* "Devise":https://github.com/plataformatec/devise
* "Will Paginate":https://github.com/xspond/will_paginate (rails3-1 branch: submodule > gem)
* "Acts As Tree":https://github.com/rails/acts_as_tree (submodule > plugin)
* "Acts As Indexed":https://github.com/dougal/acts_as_indexed (submodule > plugin)

h2. Installation

1. Update your Gemfile with the following... 

<pre>
gem 'ample_admin', :path => File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '/vendor/gems/ample_admin')
gem 'will_paginate', :path => File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '/vendor/gems/will_paginate')
gem 'devise'
</pre>

2. From the root of your application, run the following commands... 

<pre>
$ git submodule init
$ git submodule add -b rails3.1 git@github.com:ample/ample_admin.git vendor/gems/ample_admin
$ git submodule add -b rails3-1 https://github.com/xspond/will_paginate.git vendor/gems/will_paginate
$ git submodule add https://github.com/rails/acts_as_tree vendor/plugins/acts_as_tree
$ git submodule add https://github.com/dougal/acts_as_indexed vendor/plugins/acts_as_indexed
$ bundle install
$ rails generate devise:install
$ rails generate devise [MODEL]
$ rake ample_admin:install [model_name=MODEL]
</pre>

3. Edit the create_users migration generated by Devise... 

<pre>
class DeviseCreateUsers < ActiveRecord::Migration
  def self.up
    create_table(:users) do |t|
      ...
      t.boolean :admin, :default => false
      t.boolean :active, :default => false
      ...
    end
  end
end
</pre>

4. Add the new attributes to attr_accessible in your user model... 

<pre>
attr_accessible :email, :password, :password_confirmation, :remember_me, :admin, :active
</pre>

5. Override Devise's default route in config/routes.rb with the following... 

<pre>
devise_for :users, :class_name => 'User', :path_prefix => '/admin'
</pre>

6. Run your migrations and create your first admin account... 

<pre>
$ rake db:migrate
$ rails c
Loading development environment (Rails 3.1.0.rc5)
ruby-1.9.2-p180 :001 > User.create(:email => 'taylor@helloample.com', :password => '...', :password_confirmation => '...', :admin => true)
</pre>

You'll need to restart your server if you haven't already and then visit "http://localhost:3000/admin":http://localhost:3000/admin to login.
